title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: The reader's Ford F-150 requires its plastic oil pan replaced for the third time, prompting questions about upgrading to a metal pan.
Replacing the plastic oil pan under warranty takes five hours, while a metal pan replacement, not covered by warranty, takes ten hours.
The Car Doctor advises sticking with the plastic pan replacement, suggesting potential improvements in design over the years.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots players Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury missed practice due to injuries ahead of Bucs matchup.
Christian Elliss also missed Patriots practice due to a hip injury; his absence adds to team's defensive concerns.
The Buccaneers, including Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving, are also dealing with multiple injuries before Sunday's game.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, 31, a Boston youth baseball coach, pleaded not guilty to a felony fentanyl trafficking charge.
Mejia was arrested for allegedly selling over 10 grams of fentanyl to an undercover officer in October.
The charge carries a prison sentence of up to 20 years; Mejia is due back in court on December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group is closing its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices to adopt a fully remote work model.
The company operated from Boston since 2014, relocating its headquarters from Stamford, Conn.
Cengage serves nearly 4,000 employees globally and plans to continue office space evaluation with a focus on remote work.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel noted 41 players worked out on an off day, showing dedication mid-season.
Tuesday is typically the only day off for players, but many chose to lift at Gillette Stadium.
Stefon Diggs emphasized the team’s commitment, underscoring that their strong start hasn’t led to complacency.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were found dead in a Beverly home on Colonial Drive.
Officials are investigating the incident as an apparent murder-suicide with both victims suffering gunshot wounds.
Beverly police, Massachusetts State Police, and the Chief Medical Examiner are conducting the ongoing investigation.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, 65, of South Boston, sentenced to 15 years for two manslaughter charges linked to 1984 and 1993 killings.
Lewis, linked to James 'Whitey' Bulger, pleaded guilty for the deaths of Brian Watson and William Villani in separate incidents.
Lewis' plea deal reduced initial first-degree murder charges to manslaughter, reaching a compromise with the district attorney's office.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox are considering a trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, the 2024 AL Cy Young winner.
ESPN's Buster Olney states that Boston is well-positioned to bid for Skubal if Detroit puts him on the trade market.
Boston has the assets and financial capacity to acquire and retain Skubal, adding him alongside Cy Young finalist Garrett Crochet.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge halted installation of two patron saint statues at Quincy's public safety building due to religious concerns.
PETA offered financial support for statues if a third statue of St. Francis of Assisi is added.
City's plans for $850,000 statues faced criticism and legal action for lack of transparency and religious nature.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praises Drake Maye's impressive performance this season as New England Patriots' starting quarterback.
Drake Maye ranks fifth in NFL for passing yards with 2,285 and third in touchdowns with 17 so far this season.
New England Patriots hold a 7-2 record, partly due to quarterback Maye's standout contribution, amid MVP odds discussion.
